qas.question: Who was the father of Hisham?
Where did Hisham base his court?
What notable defeat was suffered by the Arabs under Hisham?
In what part of Syria was Resafa located?
Who was the first son of Abd al-Malik to become caliph?
What years did the first son of Abd al-Malik rule?
Whose reign was marked by the acceleration of military expansion?
Who stopped hostilities against the Byzantines?
Who was the final son of Hirsham?

context: The final son of <a0_0><b9_0>Abd al-Malik<b9_0/><a0_0/> to become caliph was <b5_0><b7_0><b8_0>Hisham<b8_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/> (<a1_0><b6_0>724<a1_0/>–43<b6_0/>), whose long and eventful reign was above all marked by the curtailment of military expansion. Hisham established his court at <a2_0>Resafa<a2_0/> in <a4_0>northern<a4_0/> Syria, which was closer to the Byzantine border than Damascus, and resumed hostilities against the Byzantines, which had lapsed following the failure of the last siege of Constantinople. The new campaigns resulted in a number of successful raids into Anatolia, but also in a major defeat (the <a3_0>Battle of Akroinon<a3_0/>), and did not lead to any significant territorial expansion.
